column5: Here is another video from NW Ontario chasing Lake Trout with a newbie Laker guy from the Manila
nice dance moves arnel? was that hamilton's big dumb laugh in the background? you're even luckier it wasn't him dancing.
If Jay filmed the video maybe he should have posted it.  Otherwise it's a little spammy.
Great video buddy, love to see people's first reaction when they tie into a big laker.

Hi folks, thanks for the comments! I would like to introduce myself to the members here, My handle is Buffalo Point Slow jigger as that is where I have done a lot of my early years of fishing! I am 41 years old and have fished almost all my life after 5 years old! I am not  the best angler but I have a lot of fun at it and am lucky enough to get out lots.I would always be willing to learn and accept tips from anglers  on any species! I am a member of the lund pro Staff as well as the MC for the Angler and young Angler championship series and co coordinate the stage show with Jason Hamilton, we team up to make it as exciting for the families as we can! I also am part of the Adventures North Television series  with a mini show within a show called Jason's Adventure which features close to here destinations. I also make some you tube videos with my pals on some of our outings! Hope to maybe get out to do some steel head fishing some time down in and around the Sault!  Thanks again for the comments  Jason Dean Gauthier
Enjoyed the vid. You make the fishing vid exciting to watch.  Question on the pop up? Which one were you using? It seemed to have a lot of room.  Thanks.
Thanks! It is the Eskimo Quickfish 6, good tent but on a cold cold day we figure we are going to need two mr heaters to keep it really warm, although some may say one is enough!
Welcome!  Fun video... you can totally sense the excitement of catching big lakers for the first time.
Great intro Jason and even better video!
Hey Jason !!! Great Vid.Welcome to the group I look forward to more like that  Paul
Great video Jason. Ive seen your youtube channel before..its good too.  Look forward to the next installment.  PS...keep up the good work with AYA!
Welcome to the OFC!!! Gotta love lakers through the ice, they were made for ice fishing. Very entertaining video, by the way.
